clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Renal Perfusion CEUS Against MRI
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of Contrast Enhanced Ultrasound (CEUS) for the Assessment of Renal Perfusion Using Renal Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is establishing a new ultrasound technique to improve assessment of kidney blood flow.

detailed_description.textblock: Kidneys have an extremely high blood flow. A quarter of the blood that is pumped by the heart goes to the kidneys, and your entire blood volume passes through your kidneys forty times each day. Some of this blood flow is needed to keep the kidneys healthy by delivering oxygen and nutrients; this delivery of blood to the kidney is called 'perfusion'. We would like to perform a research study to test how well a new type of ultrasound scanning (called Contrast Enhanced UltraSound or CEUS) can measure kidney perfusion. We will do this by comparing CEUS with MRI scans which is the 'gold-standard' method of measuring kidney perfusion. If CEUS performs well, then this will allow future studies in which CEUS can be used to help patients with kidney disease

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between ASL-MRI and CEUS measures of renal perfusion
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be the correlation between ASL-MRI measures of cortical perfusion (ml/ 100g/min) and CEUS measures of renal microvascular blood flow.

secondary_outcome.description: Intra-individual reproducibility of the CEUS measures will be assessed by taking at least two measures in each individual to calculate coefficient of variation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between global perfusion from PC-MRI corrected flow measures and CEUS
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between global perfusion from Phase contrast magnetic resonance Imaging corrected flow measures and CEUS

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between kinetic time-intensity parameters of CEUS and time-resolved MRA
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between kinetic time-intensity parameters of CEUS and time-resolved Magnetic Resonance Angiography

arm_group.description: 18 - 40 years old (n=10) Healthy male or female and able to give informed, written consent.
70 years or older (n=10) Healthy male or female and able to give informed, written consent.

intervention.description: This is a regular ultrasound scanner used with an ultrasound contrast agent injected through veins to allow for kidney perfusion acquisition.
Arterial spin labelling is an MRI technique allow for measuring tissue perfusion. It uses magnetically labelled arterial blood water protons as a tracer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male or female aged 18 years or older and able to give informed, written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- estimated Globular Filtration Rate (eGFR) <60ml/min or albuminuria
- Diabetes
- Prescription of anti-hypertensive agents that alter renal haemodynamics (renal angiotensin
- Known allergy to SonoVue contrast agent
- Contraindications to MRI
